intro: Helenium seidlitzii, commonly known as the orange hawkweed, is a perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has upright, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Helenium seidlitzii is known for its ornamental value in gardens due to its showy flowers and ability to thrive in well-drained soil. It is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
